bibl.title: A Note on the Pseudepigraphal Allusion in Oxyrhynchus Papyrus No. 4365.
bibl.note: P. Oxy. LXIII, 4365 contains the earliest surviving Greek manuscript reference to the pseudepigraphal Book of Jubilees (ἡ λεπτὴ Γένεσις, the 'detailed' Genesis). [See already: Dieter HAGEDORN, Die "Kleine Genesis" in P. Oxy. LXIII 4365, ZPE 116 (1997) pp. 147-148.]
bibl.seg: FRANKLIN Simon, A Note on the Pseudepigraphal Allusion in Oxyrhynchus Papyrus No. 4365.

P. Oxy. LXIII, 4365 contains the earliest surviving Greek manuscript reference to the pseudepigraphal Book of Jubilees (ἡ λεπτὴ Γένεσις, the 'detailed' Genesis). [See already: Dieter HAGEDORN, Die "Kleine Genesis" in P. Oxy. LXIII 4365, ZPE 116 (1997) pp. 147-148.]
